title: U.S. intelligence says Ukraine will fail to meet offensive’s key goal
description: Thwarted by minefields, Ukrainian forces won’t manage to reach the city of Melitopol, a vital Russian transit hub, according to a U.S. intelligence assessment.

title: Pentagon biodefense review points to Chinese, Russian threats
description: The Defense Department’s biodefense review highlights Beijing’s militarization of biological technology and research as a growing concern.

title: Iran arrests 12 female activists in crackdown ahead of protest anniversary
description: The move comes amid efforts to deter protests ahead of the first anniversary of the uprising that followed the death of Mahsa Amini in “morality police” custody.

title: Zelensky extends martial law, casting doubt on fall parliamentary elections
description: Ukraine is due to hold elections by Oct. 29, but political activity is suspended under martial law and a vote seems impossible given Russia’s occupation of a fifth of the country.

title: This ‘crooked’ pub was older than the U.S. Why would someone burn it down?
description: Britain is gripped by the mystery of how the 258-year-old Crooked House burned down and its ruins were abruptly demolished. Police suspect foul play.

title: Pakistan arrests 130 people after churches attacked on blasphemy rumor
description: At least five churches and many homes were attacked and looted by mobs, which the police spokesman called well-coordinated in the latest blasphemy riot in Pakistan.

title: More than 60 feared dead off Cape Verde islands after migrant boat found
description: A boat carrying 101 people left Senegal on July 10. After more than a month at sea, 63 people are now feared dead or missing, the U.N.’s migration agency says.

title: In pictures and video: Wildfires burn across Spanish island of Tenerife
description: The president of the Canary Islands, which Tenerife is a part of, called the blaze “out of control.” It comes after a heat wave brought hot and dry air, increasing the risk of wildfires.

title: Wildfire triggers race to evacuate entire Canadian city of Yellowknife
description: Officials in Canada urged some 20,000 residents to evacuate Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories as a wildfire poses “a real threat to the city.”

title: Michael Parkinson, popular British talk-show host, dies at 88
description: His program became a regular stopping point for entertainers, athletes, politicians and other international newsmakers from Madonna to Nelson Mandela to Muhammad Ali.

title: Inside the Russian effort to build 6,000 attack drones with Iran’s help
description: Leaked documents show that, despite delays, Moscow is progressing toward its goal of mass producing drones that could be used against Ukraine.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv’s forces assert recapture of southeastern Ukrainian village; F-16 deployment not expected this year
description: Ukraine paid a high price in casualties for retaking the village in the Donetsk region, a Russian-aligned commander said.

title: A rusting tanker, a civil war: Averting environmental disaster in Yemen
description: The U.N. spearheaded an operation to transfer some 42 million gallons of oil from a decaying supertanker — a rare dose of good news for war-racked Yemen.

title: How The Post reported on the Smithsonian’s human remains
description: From the Philippine Exhibition at the 1904 World’s Fair to a collection of human remains at the Smithsonian, here’s how ‘The Collection’ project developed.

title: Biden to host stand-alone summit with Japan and South Korea, a first
description: The summit shows how China's military aggression and economic coercion are drawing the United States and its two most important Asian allies closer together.
